name: Dinner Tonight: Chorizo, Potato, and Mushroom Tacos
description: I had little chorizo leftover from Monday’s fantastic chorizo, egg and raisin meal, and instead of making that same meal for the third time, I figured I’d try to see what else I could find. Contrary to all rationale, I was still in a taco munching mood, and so I quickly went for the Mexican guide to all things quick and easy, Rick Bayless. This isn’t the first time.
recipeIngredient: 2 small red skinned potatoes, peeled and grated

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the chorizo in a skillet over medium heat, breaking up the chunks with a wooden spoon, for about 4 minutes
Turn the heat to medium-high, add the oil if the chorizo has leaked off any of its own, and toss in the onion and mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the grated potatoes. Cook for another 5 mintues or until the potatoes are soft, stirring occasionally. Season with salt.
Serve with some warm tortillas and top with some salsa and cilantro.
